intro: Hisingera spiculifera, commonly known as the spiky sea anemone, is a marine cnidarian found in shallow coastal waters. It has a distinctive morphology with a short, cylindrical body and long, slender tentacles. The organism is typically found attached to rocks or other substrates in tidal zones. Its coloration can vary, often appearing in shades of yellow or brown. Hisingera spiculifera plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and serving as prey for larger predators.
